page.title: 18POLITICS.
page.content: At one time the village was keenly interested in national and local politics. The farmers and landowners were members of the local Conservative group and the farm labourers were mostly Labour supporters. Feelings ran high at election meetings, candidates spoke to the electorate in the village school. Labour held a strong numerical advantage. Today the position is reversed. Many of the new residents are Conservatives, the farm men have long gone. Political interest seems to have been dissipated and there is no real excitement in the village today at election times. Probably television decides the issues, rather than local meetings.
